intro: Wendlandia montana, commonly known as the mountain wendlandia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sun. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly pubescent surface. The flowers, which bloom in spring, range in color from white to pink and are often used in ornamental horticulture.
